content.description:
Let the World Spin ascends a solid, fridge-like structure on good edges over a nice landing.

Sit start with a right hand on a good sidepull and a left hand on the blunt arete. From there, bump the left up to a pinch, hit a good-sized edge with the right, then match hands on a decent edge up and to the left. From there, stick a small but positive edge (crux), work the remaining bumps, and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads will do it, the immediate fall zone is perfect. There are, however, some rocks surrounding the area though.
content.location:
This ascends the southwest face of Diagon Boulder. It shares some of the same space as

Llorona

, but instead of going straight up, it incorporates a good edge and several other different holds that are out to the left.

content.description:
Pogonip is a short, deceivingly difficult problem with a fun finishing move.

Sit start with a big right hand sidepull and a sloping left hand. From there, pull up to a left hand crimp, follow with a right to another crimp (hold the barn door/crux?), then gain a left hand tooth/sidepull, achieve a high foot (crux?), and make a good-sized move to the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad should do it, the landing is flat and clear, but there are some trees behind it.
content.location: It ascends the center of the north face of Diagon Boulder.

content.description:
Llorona ascends a slightly overhung face on small crimps.

Sit start with a left hand edge, a right hand edge, and a left heel hook. From there, pull up to a right hand diagonal rail, then bump the left up to an edge/pinch, bump the left again to a crimp (crux?), set the feet and hit a high right hand crimp (crux?), bump the left up to an incut three-finger edge, hit the bumps at the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads should be fine, the landing is very good, there are some trees and rock behind the problem though.
content.location:
It ascends the south face of Diagon Boulder. This shares some of the same rock which

Let The World Spin

climbs on. Though very close in space, the movement and experience between the two problems are quite different.
